title: Vaah
review: This Haveli is a great attraction in Jaisalmer, very much small kind of work in almost every where, greatly appreciated work by those workers.

title: Beautiful Haveli
review: Nathmal Ji Ki Haveli is one of the more famous havelis that the tourists visit in Jaisalmer. On paying the entrance fee one can visit the Haveli and see for themselves the beautiful architecture that caters for the desert hot weather like jharokhas and open courtyards. Definitely a nice place to visit in Jaisalmer.

title: Nathmal Ji Ki Haveli
review: Nathmal Ji Ki Haveli is one of famous haveli in Jaisalmer. amazing work and architecture. worth to visit this place. this place is constructed by two brothers.

title: Excellent example of stone work.
review: The place is the excellent work of the sand stone work. The left and right side of the place are constructed by two brothers and is having many differences in work is seen carefully from front.

title: Ordinary
review: This is another haveli in the Jaisalmer Fort complex that is considered as a point of visit but its pretty ordinary and not that impressive, just yet another old building.

title: Not good
review: You can enter the varandah but not allowed to see the whole building..just took 5minutes to see..kind of waste of time..instead spend time on patwon ki haweli..which is far better..

title: GIFT SHOP RIP OFF
review: The building is beautiful but their gift shop is a total scam. They are selling plastic resin objects claiming that they are carved from camel bone, and for exorbitant prices. This kind of dishonesty and contemptuous behaviour towards tourists leaves a bad taste and creates distrust. Shame on them.

title: Only Exterior is Good.
review: Only exterior is good and tourists are not allowed to view from inside since its people's are staying.

title: Haveli
review: Good Stonework , and worth seeing from outside it is 3 floor havelli keep going up on narrow stairs and nothing much to see , not kept well just some old stuff better to see from outside .

title: awesome fine stonework
review: can't go inside or upstairs. watch out as it is situated in a narrow lane of old city, lined by open sewers and dotted by fresh cow dung.

title: Just a competition of Patwon Ki haveli
review: Just another beauty, however doesn't even come close to Patwon ki haveli. Though quit beautiful, shopping hungry can explore near by houses for authentic rajasthani handloom work.

title: A very nice Haveli, and how the whealthy merchants lived
review: Wandering around an alley inside the Fort, we found this very nice haveli, with a reasonable entry price. We enjoyed discovering the life of rich merchants in a middle age city...

title: Grandeur personified
review: Jaisalmer is dotted with numerous havelis and Nathmalji ki Haveli deserves a mention too. To reach this monument, either take a rickshaw or just walk the short distance.

title: Haveli is beautiful, but people iscrimnate
review: Nathmal ji ki haveli is one of the beautiful havelis in Jaisalmer. Beautiful architecture and design, it certainly impresses everyone. But it is written there that families stay in the haveli so entry to upper floors is not allowed. But I saw a local lady taking foreign nationals taking inside the haveli and on upper floors. I asked 2 men and 1 lady how those people were allowed. First they avoided to answer, later gave the reason that they went to exchange the money (I hope it is not the only money changing unit in Jaisalmer). In short, people there discriminate between Indians and foreigners (in fact Jaisalmer gets its majority of income from Indian tourists). So if Indians go there they should protest against this if they see something like this.

title: Glimpse of past
review: Nathmal ki haveli, is located inside the Jaisalmer fort, is a multi story haveli where you can experience how the rich merchants used to live during old times. There is an nominal entry fee to visit it. You can visit it if you don't have the time to visit Patwon ki haveli or Salim Singh ki haveli. Once have to go through stairs (some are quite steep) when going up or down in the haveli. Each floor have different themes exhibits showing the old ways of living.

title: just a normal house
review: there are shops inside and you will find family members of the house sitting inside.you can just enter inside the couryard and see the house

title: Just good
review: Nathmal ki haveli.,is located inside the jaisalmer fort, is a multi story haveli .at first glance the carvings seem uniform over the entire structure and it's on keen observation.. Hend carving of stone! I,m impressed.

title: Interesting architecture
review: The mansion made by 2 brothers...there are differences in the design...but take a look inside...artifacts made from camel bones

title: Great haveli depicting complete life of royals.. Worth a visit
review: Situated in narrow lanes, you hit upon on this big and beautiful haveli. Ignore touts and "guides" who will pester you .. just buy ticket and go around exploring the beauty of this place which show cases the royals life completely from how they cooked food, dressed, slept and many other interesting antique pieces that are on display. spend at least 2 hours here.

title: Avoid it if possible
review: This is a private property and cannot enter it as it is a private property. It is almost like the Hawa Mahal of Jaipur and enjoy it in the photos and nothing else.

title: Nice haveli
review: All the three havelis are nearby the fort and are part and package of the Jaisalmer city tour, front facades look pretty similar for all the three. Intricate jaali works are amusing.

title: 'Very good' for a grand, intricately carved, splendid, Posh House in midst of Jaisalmer Old City
review: Built in 19th century by 2 Brothers to House then then Prime Minister, it remains a very impressive building with an extraordinary hand-carved façade of mostly sandstone.

title: Breathtaking elevation
review: Interesting Elevation, probably better than other havelis around

title: Well kept Haveli but more a shop than an historic building
review: An Haveli built to display wealth and power, it is very impressive from the outside with ornate carvings and 2 huge elephants. I wouldn’t bother paying to enter but if part of your tour then it is worth briefly pottering around. It is more a tourist shop upstairs than a museum but you can still politely decline the patter and look at the ceilings and other carvings

title: Very rude owner
review: The owner of this building is the most unfriendly person I've ever met.

title: Stunning exteriors
review: This haveli is a sight to behold ..the right and left wings seem identical but are not.They were  made by two brothers ...the story goes that they both started from the outer ends of the haveli neither of them saw the others construction.However when the two wings finally joined  in the centre they were so similar and yet not the same.Two sandstone elephants are on either side of the doorway.The most intricately carved haveli it can be viewed only from the street outside.

title: Can't enter inside
review: At best just click the pictures from outside and that's it. The architecture is interesting as you can see the 2 brothers doing their bit and its similar and yet dis similar at places.

title: Interesting history
review: The history behind Nathmal Ji ki Haveli is very interesting. Especially the part where the left and right halves are slightly different from each other. Figuring out the differences was the best part.

title: Just for the architecture
review: We took a guide to walk us around in the city. He explained us that the two architects who were brothers have worked on this Haveli of diwan of Jaisalmer. They decided to have the Haveli exteriors carved differently yet it should look similar. One can't spot the differences on their own unless being pointed to. You can't go inside the Haveli after a point as the current owner's family resides there. Inside the haveli, at chowki, you will find souveniers if you wish to buy it. Little expensive though.

title: another intricately carved haveli
review: These are actually havelis belonging to two different bros. at first glance the carvings seem uniform over the entire structure and its on keen observation that one notices the partition in between and the difference between the left and right side of the haveli

title: Time Waste
review: after seeing the palace and other havelis there is nothing left with the nathmal ki haveli. A nice structured haveli. But nothing more than that. Entry fees are preety high. Ancestors of nathmal family collect this fees as per their wish. People visit this place just to tell others "yes we have visited that". Trust me, you can skip this place. Better to take rest in the hotel room or go for a movie in local cinema hall.

title: Interesting Place
review: This is an interesting place to visit as it was built by two artisans and both built right and left half of it. Though  at first glance one misses it but then you start finding that the detailing done by both artisans were different and both the sides though looking similar are still different. It is a née game to find out the differences.

title: Famous Havelis of Jaisalmer
review: During late nineteenth century , Jaisalmer was a big trading centre on silk route.

title: One of the famous havelis in the city
review: This beautiful haveli was built by two brothers in the 19th century. The two men worked on two sides of the house, so that both sides are similar yet uniquely different.

title: Go for the architetcure
review: Jaisalmer is all about Hawelis. This one is one of them. You may chose to give an entry fee and go and check-out the inside. Its pretty beautiful on the outside too. Go to the roof and get a panaromic view of the Jaisalmer Fort and Salim Singh ki haweli.

title: helpful tour guide and worthwhile visit
review: the haveli has a long history, the youngsters offering guided tour may not initially instill confidence, but some of them are truly knowledgeable and very good. The old world charm is unmistakeable in the haveli apart from the wonderful display of sarees in the boutique run within the haveli

title: Private property with limited viewing!
review: This haveli is now a private property and you can only see the atrium of this haveli and the souvenir and painting shops at the entrance. Quite close to Patwaon ki Haveli but not worth the time and effort specially if you have seen Patwaon ki Haveli and Salim Singhji ki Haveli.

title: Haveli
review: This haveli seems not to be maintained and its a private property you have access only to the ground floor.

title: Private property
review: You are not allowed to enter there,you can only see it from road.it also not maintained well. Waste to visit it

title: seen fro outside
review: It is one of the many havelis in Jaisalmer. It seems to be beautiful from outside. You can see two idol of elephant on either side on the entrance.

title: A fun story to this quirky haveli with trinkets galore to buy.
review: A local guide took us here during our stay in Jaisalmer. The guide told us a fun story of how the beautiful building was built (I won't spoil it here) and you can see the intricate craftsmanship for yourself in the carvings and paintings of the traditional havelis. Looking inside and the current owners are family and descendants of the original owners. They are fully committed to the preservation of this place and profits from your purchases go towards the haveli's upkeep. There is no pressure to buy and good attentive service on hand should you need it. The trinkets on display to browse and buy are many, from camel bone elephants to paintings of various Hindu deities. Really worth stopping by for photos and a browse if not for a spending spree.

title: similar to salim haveli..waste of time
review: Inside tour - NOT ALLOWED

title: A living museum
review: The most interesting fact was that this residence was designed by 2 architect brothers. There are subtle differences both internal and external and it gives the impression was built off-site with the 2 halves stuck together.

title: Great piece of Architechture
review: Good carvings but one has to climb lots of stairs to see the haveli.

title: Beautiful palace and museum
review: The authenticity is the charm. The palaces are turned into tourist destination and heads up for archaeological and architect students.

title: Architectural marvel
review: This Haveli is famous for its archtiecture that reflects the fusion of both Rajput and Islamic styles.The facade of this Haveli include birds,elephants,flowers etc.Two elephants made of yellow stone have engraved at the main entrance.

title: beautiful
review: this haveli is private property now. you can watch this haveli from outside.it is a good example of architectural beauty.

title: A building of two halves!
review: What first struck me first was that the buildings were symetrical but closer inspection revealed that the brothers had stamped their identity on their facades with subtle variations to widow, balcony and door details. This family run museum sells competitively priced carved camel bone artifacts and much much more, unlike the overpriced Government shops.

title: Must see to compare with Patwon Ki Haveli
review: From the fort hire an auto to reach this haveli. Ask the local people to locate the exact place. Without watching this haveli you can't assess the beauty of Patwon Ki Haveli.

title: private house
review: you can enter the atrium because there are some shops but you woth get to the house itself. its very nice from the steet though

title: The architecture is very nice
review: If are fond of the beauty of history & architecture, this a must vist place. But you have to visit with a good guide.

title: I have to thank the Guide
review: Architecture and the small reasons for following the pattern of architecture was explained to us by our guide.. His name starts with R (raja or ravi) which I clearly cannot recall. He not only explained us the structure but also the small house hold things used. Example: Uneven stairways were made to catch hold of a spy in dark. Little details but made a great impact on understanding people and their needs in those days. Thank you Mr. Guide.

title: decent attraction to spend 15 min
review: There is entry fee which you have to pay for visiting the haveli. People still stay here and there are very few rooms/spots you can visit. it is situated in city center. I did not find it worth.

title: Give a miss
review: I did not find any touristic value by visiting this. This can straightaway be given a miss so that you save around one hour for using that in desert camp. The building architecture wise is good thouh. But you wont be allowed an entry inside as this is still a private residence.

title: Quirky Haveli
review: The Nathmal Haveli was worth a visit even if the "tour" was the tiniest tour I had been on!!  Former home to a Prime Minister of Rajasthan a descendant, who now lives in the house, took us up stairs were we saw one room!

title: Another Lovely Haveli
review: One of my favourite Haveli in Jaisalmer, the elephant statue is important as the owner would not have been able to display the elephant without consent of the maharaja, so he was obviously connected.  As per all the haveli in Jaisalmer the latticework carving in the stone is amazing and you spend a good ten minutes just taking in each window and every metre of the façade of the place.  An easy walk from the fort and can be done in conjunction with walk to other haveli and the lake.

title: Not Visitor Friendly, Only shopping encouraged
review: After visiting the world famous Patwon ki Haveli, was looking forward to see the speciality of this Haveli. Disappointed as the family members staying inside were interested only in selling souvenirs to foreigners and discouraged Indian visitors who asked about culture, history, artifacts.

title: Must see
review: Don't miss this. The two halves

title: Skip the interior if you are on your own.
review: I have been to Jaisalmer twice on  group tours.  Both times the guide took us to this haveli.  It does indeed have a beautifully carved facade which bears some attention to compare the treatment by the brother architects.  However, after a few minutes of introduction (and not enough time to really do a comparison), we were hustled inside to get a "tour" by a descendant of the original family.  Both times we were immediately ushered upstairs to a gift shop which supports "upkeep and restoration" of the haveli.  On neither tour did we "have time" to see the interior of the Patwaon-Ki Haveli.

title: Nice
review: It is very close to gandhi chowk and Golden Fort. You can see it only from outside and lit bit from inside. You can only take pictures which you gonna love it.

title: Tale of Brothers in same house
review: As per my guide the history of Haveli is that they were the head architect of the palace, the carving, designs, shapes, the structure of doors and windows and everything was done by Nathmal brothers. When work got over king gave them the land and material to construct a home for themselves. On the right side there is 1 brother and on left it's another. the way it can be distinguishes is the carving work done on both the side. So although it looks same but actually it's different. I am describing by points on which art work is done:

title: Great architecture
review: Great place to visit in Jaisalmer. History has it that 2 brothers were commissioned to build this haveli. But they couldn't see eye-to-eye so they copied each other's designs with subtle modifications.  One half is built by one brother, and the other half by the other. The distinctions are worth noting and the carving work is fantastic.

title: Structural beauty--skip the interior tour
review: The building has outstanding architectural features, but I rate this as poor because our guide hauled us inside for "the tour."  This "tour" consisted of only 2 very dingy rooms of minimal interest.  For this bogus "tour" the owner informed us that we had to purchase an expensive souvenir for which we had no need.  This was required to help maintain the building and they don't charge admission.  Well, for so little to see, admission would have cost very little compared to the souvenir purchase.  Look at the exterior and avoid entering the building.

title: Nothing great
review: Similar to patwon Ki haweli . Half of building is designed by one worker and other half by other worker . Now someone is living in that haweli . Except for architecture and carving nothing else to see

title: Dont value Indian
review: Very bad experience. Person taking care of this place dont entertain Indian. they only entertain foreigner. And on asking them y they dont allow us to go on top as we saw few foreigner going they started fighting with us .The lady sitting over there say if u have dollar then only u can go.

title: Soviners & musem shop
review: You can visit this place, however it has been converted into a souvenir shop. This place looks good from outside and do only if time permits

title: Another tourist attraction
review: Its also an architectural with different type of haveli situated in jaisalmer. Its combination of islamic as well modern picture carving in wall of haveli like car etc.

title: Can be missed
review: This haveli was not on my itinerary, but the guide we had engaged for the day insisted on taking us here. Needless to say, it was mainly because this haveli hosts a souvenir shop, and the guides get commission both on bringing visitors there, as well as on the items they buy. we had much time to while away, so we didnt mind. But if you are pressed for time, it is better that you spend time in jaisalmer fort or the patwaon ki haveli. there is a litle bit of history to this haveli - each half of the haveli was built by 2 brothers and in the exterior you can see the distinct differences they brought about in the architecture and embellishments. There is nothing great inside, it is a private haveli and people still live here. One part of the haveli is converted into a shop, but the souvenirs are nothing different from what you would find elsewhere, and any claims of antiqueness can be left upto your own judgement.

title: Nice Haveli
review: Old and nice haveli. These havelis are famous for its cravings on the red stone. The roads to these havelis are very narrow and you car will not reach there. You have to hire a auto from the stand to reach these places. The auto driver will be your guide.

title: tourist attraction
review: Its just has beautiful architecture, and looks good from the outside, like another haveli of Rajesthan only different location. There are many souvenir shops in this Haveli. People still resides here and its a private . Could be missed.

title: Commercial Commercial
review: Its a commercial space with shops inside the haveli for many things, just the art done on the exterior walls of the haveli

title: Bogus don't go
review: Its a waste of time. This is a living house, you wont be able to enter unless you buy from the shop.

title: The works are exquisite , the behaviour of the people inside tasteless
review: The carvings are intricately done , till nearly attaining perfection with two storeys showing two starkly different styles. Much like Dilwara Temple , it is a treat to eyes. But one has to learn to be deaf, or that is what I had to face. The signs within were grammatically incorrect and the person arrogant and ignorant of English or common courtesy or manners. Just because it is a private property , one isn't supposed to face such a disgusting barrage of speech.. That part of the experience left a bitter tinge.

title: Historical place
review: This Haveli is constructed by two artist simultaneously one started with right and the another started with left and they kept their identity through their work as it can be seen at this place on every wall, columns etc.with the intricate design

title: Commercial Place
review: The place where family lives and shops, nothing much to see except exterior art work. you can visit this place if you had additional time

title: AVERAGE
review: Since in Jaisalmer fort see everything included in it does not have anything to take a look. It took a visit.

title: Wonderful Carvings
review: A very short visit is worthwhile. The building is on the street and can be quite busy. The best is seen from outside but if not too busy worth going inside. The intricate carvings are mirrored on each side of the building but each side unique as undertaken by two different artist brothers. The interior is a shop and family home. The family do tend to control entry as the interior is not that large and for safety don't want it over crowded. While we were there the lady of the house explained to some visitors that it was also a family home and as they were about to have lunch, they were going to close the upper floors to the public for a short while but they were welcome and could come back in around half an hour. A very rude response was her reward for what was a very polite explanation! The shop is full of copy artefacts and some real antiques. There was no real pressure on us to buy anything and offered at a reasonable price without too much haggling.

title: commercial
review: had very bad experience. the owner landlady was after the foreigners for dollars. we were not allowed to go on top floor where already some foreingers were.

title: Just another Haveli
review: Nathmal ki Haveli is almost 500 meters from Patwan Ki Haveli. But this is located inside a lane. So one need to walk around the alleys from Patwan Haveli to rech Nathmal's Haveli. Again an old haveli, but this one is not maintained well like Patwan haveli. It is good to see, if you have extra time in hand, or else can be skipped.

title: nice haveli in city centre
review: lovely haveli built by two brothers simultaneously, has elephants carved at door, in the city centre you pass by it while walking to other attractions

title: Old Glory of the Diwan of jaisalmer by name Nathumaljiki haveli
review: This is worth visiting the haveli was built by two brothers carved its two sides .Although the motif used by one is not similar to the other. but they are in harmony .This is a private property of divanji's and there 6th generastion staying here.

title: RICH ARCHITECTURAL SPLENDOR
review: One of the beautiful and marvellous mansions of Jaisalmer.  Its a must visit for every tourist.  Nathmalji-ki-Haveli of Jaisalmer in Rajasthan bears relics to the rich architectural splendor of the ancient times. A unique feature of the marvelous architectural monument of Nathmalji-ki-Haveli is the giant structure of two elephants of yellow sand stone at the main entrance of the beautiful edifice

title: enchanting...
review: This haveli was constructed by the end of XIX century and served as the residence of the Prime Minister.Though the havelis look beautiful from outside, there are only small small shops inside. One gets the view of the city from the higher floors.

title: Bug you the whole time to buy stuff
review: high pressure sales. I could not enjoy the place because of them trying to pressure me into buying things. The prices are inflated and the merchandise was not authentic, but cheap re-makes. Try somewhere that does not have a focus on the gift shop. Even when I did buy a few things, they still kept pushing me to buy more, offered to drive me to an ATM machine...I could not enjoy a moment of peace to look at the structure--

title: good
review: Nathmalji's Haveli  has a beautiful architecture .less crowded .kings dynasty resides in this haveli.entry restricted to see inside.permission has to  to see the royal family.the board inside like that.

title: Haveli
review: Fantastic place to visit with lovely little built in seats from where you can watch the grandeous architecture and people

title: Beautiful and historically rich haveli
review: Next day was Nathmalji Ki Haveli, another beautiful and historically rich haveli that used to be the house of Mohta Nathmal, the then prime minister at the Jaisalmer royal court. The haveli boasts of a rich architecture splendor with stone carved windows and walls ornamented with stone figures of horses, elephants, flowers and birds. The entrance of the haveli is guarded by two big yellow sandstone elephants, one on each side. Thus ended our first day of mighty exploration and eye warming glitzy experience of Rajasthan’s royal history. Tired we retired dreaming about what the next day had in store for us.

title: Commercial haveli
review: Its a commercial space with shops inside the haveli for many things, just the art done on the exterior walls of the haveli

title: Commercial Space
review: Its a commercial space moreover a haveli with shops inside it for foreign tourists nothing much to see besides art on exterior walls

title: Maintenance Required
review: This is a beautiful Haveli that is falling into disrepair on the exterior. The interior is closed to vistors and I imagine it to be in disgraceful condition too.

title: The exterior is gorgeous.
review: You can't go round the interior   --   only into a little courtyard   --   so the real attraction is gazing at the exterior, which is just gorgeous, intricately carved in that lovely golden stone.

title: Impressive facade
review: We did not venture inside but a walk around the narrow lanes and by lanes of Jodhpur around the fort will lead you to the haveli. The haveli has beautiful carvings on the outside. The streets around have much to admire in terms of handicrafts but a good bargain is a must.

title: Breezy Haveli
review: With lots of Jharokhas to enjoy the breeze this was at one time owned by Nath Mal who was a very rich man in the town. His utensils and other articles that his family used are at display. Take a tour of the full Haveli.

title: disappointed
review: It was not much of an attraction.. Almost all housed in Jaisalmer looks same. You can do a little bit of ethinic shopping there, but there is not much to see.. only the ground floor which jas some shops..

title: Not as impressive
review: We visited the haveli during our trip in March. Though the havelis look beautiful from outside, there are only small small shops inside. One gets the view of the city from the higher floors.

title: Amazing facade
review: This is also another haveli which has been restored and converted into a museum. The carvings on the facade are exceptional.

title: Amazing work of a jeweller - in stone
review: The residence of the former Prime Minister of Jaisalmer, it is built in yellow sandstone.  Elephants in sandstone on either side of the splendidly carved entrance door welcome you and give the building grandeur.  Carvings of horses, cattle, flora, cars and fans adorn the pillars and walls.  Well preserved and worth the time.

title: Fantastic work on stone
review: This haveli was constructed by the end of XIX century and served as the residence of the Prime Minister (and is still partly occupied). The haveli is covered on the outside with very unusual intricately carvings and with gold plated beautiful paintings on the 1st floor (1.5 kg of gold was used). Around the doorway British postcards of the XIX century and the image of Queen Victoria are hanging. Left and right wing look similar, but are not identical, thus the work was done by two architects, two brothers whose competitive spirit gave the world a work of art.

title: Nice architecture and view
review: Very nicely built. The architecture in this palce is awesome. There are 4-5 haveli's that you can see. View from rooftop is awesome. You will feel like you are seeing a city made entirely of gold. The sun has that golden effect on the sand coloured buildings. Amazing.Cleanliness is on the lower side though....

title: Good
review: Wonderful architecture and stone carvings. Small lanes leading to this place is good for shopping. One can enjoy Rajasthan by walking in these small lanes.

title: Exquisite
review: In the midst of so many fabulous haveli, this one is a gem and it is still a private home, with the owner sowing us around the front section.

title: Photo the exterior and move on
review: We stood outside, leaned against the low wall opposite and happily took photos of the exterior of this haveli whilst chatting with a couple from Kolkata.

title: Beautiful Haveli
review: Really beautiful old Haveli which is architecturally wonderful with beautiful carvings and the outside carvings are a treat to the eyes. The shopping opportunity in and around this Haveli which needs to be accessed by road is very good.

title: Puzzle haveli
review: As said by others- it can be skipped, sure ,there is nothing extraordinary to see in this haveli.

title: Good peek at history
review: Nicely arranged and neat display of lifestyle of Marwari businessman around 200 years ago. The mansion looks great with open courtyards

title: can be skipped
review: Except having a look from outside ..there is almost nothing to do. you can only enter a few steps inside the haveli..and that is it..as the family still stay there. They have converted the outer part of the haveli in a kind of small shop for paintings and soveneirs..and that is it.

title: beware of Bats
review: I entered this haveli first & surprised to see everybody was roaming in the ground floor. Feels like nobody was interested in visiting the haveli. Then we went upstairs clicked some beautiful shots. Just after this I have seen there were hundreds of bats ( chamgadad) were hanging on the roof & also on the stairs. Immediately we rushed to the exit to save ourselves. This was one of the horrible experiences we had during our jaisalmer trip.

title: Over hyped.!
review: If you visit Patwon Ki Haveli, then no need to visit Nathmal Ji Ki Haveli & Salim Haveli and hence can be skipped and time would be saved. Further general public is not allowed to go inside. You can just view the Haveli from outside.

title: Skip
review: People still live here. If you would like to visit place where old grandmas holler from their windows to urchins outside or see women scrub their front porch as clothes also dry on the side, go visit. Or else skip it. Patwon ki Haveli is better, and it is not too far from here.

title: Pathetic State
review: There are three Haveli's in Jaisalmer, all of them are being used by the descendants of those who once lived there.  They are in a pathetic condition, you cannot go inside  since they are people still living there, but can see it from outside only.

title: Rajasthani Splendour
review: The beauty of the haveli is the stone work done on the walls, the jalis, the doorways, the huge open courtyard in front of the haveli. a must visit.

title: Gud place to visit
review: This is Worth Visiting. Actually This is divided into 5 Parts of which first is only available for Visit. this is a Private Property. Amazingly built and very beautiful. Must visit

title: Life in Rajasthan
review: If you walk the narrow streets of Jaisalmer and you admire all the surrounding havelis then you should not miss this one. You can easily recognize it by the two elephants guarding its entrance. You can also visit the haveli and get a flavor of how people are living in this beautifully carved building. Get a feeling of cool air inside and the shade from the desert sun. Climb to the rooftop and enjoy the cool breeze in the evenings or early mornings. Watch the street life down below and take in the simple things that make people's lives in Jaisalmer.

title: Not open to public beyond the main courtyard
review: Not open to public beyond the main courtyard. If you have seen Patwaon ki Haveli, then this will underwhelm you

title: Beautiful jali work
review: The carvings on this haveli are exquisite. Like all buildings in Jaisalmer, the facade is in golden stone with extremely delicate carving.

title: out side look only
review: nothing inside this haveli...but the stone work is amazing...must see....near to fort....its around 140 years old...a like patwa haveli

title: OUTSIDE VIEW
review: I request foreigners not to take these sturctures to seriously. These buildings are of erstwhile servants or helpers to the king. Today they show it too public and earn while just 45 km away in the Thar Desert you will find poor kids of 13-14 guiding your camel, better pay them instead of these havellis.

title: Not so great.
review: If you visit Patwon Ki Haveli, then no need to visit Nathmal Ji Ki Haveli & Salim Haveli.

title: Can miss
review: visitors are only allowed till the first courtyard of the havelli. there are a few shops inside.

title: Good from outside
review: This haveli is really beautiful but from outside only. Inside here is not much to see. Carvings and designs are beautiful

title: Only for enthusiasts
review: After Salim singh and patwaon-ki-haveli, nathmal ji was a bit disappointing. it's still worth a quick visit if you're not pressed for time.

title: “Good from outside”
review: he beauty of the haveli is the stone work done on the walls, the jalis, the doorways, the huge open courtyard in front of the haveli. a must visit.

title: architecure at its best
review: the beauty of the haveli is the stone work done on the walls, the jalis, the doorways, the huge open courtyard in front of the haveli. a must visit.

title: Good only from OUtside
review: Nice haveli good looks from outside but inside you don't have anything to do as people are leaving and that is the reason they are not charging.

title: Attractive facade, but not much inside
review: Worth a stop while wandering through the back streets of Jaisalmer town. As other reviewers have already stated, the outside is quite attractive. The interior is nothing particularly special though and 10 minutes is more than enough to get a feel for the place.

title: Do visit..
review: The Haveli s are very nice, this is much smaller compared to the others but nevertheless well kept..its great walking around them..

title: Fabulous facades
review: You can't go into these havelis but that doesnt matter as the real beauty of them are the quite incredible facades dominated by very typical Rajasthani workmanship. Sit back and marvel at the craftwork.

title: Fantastic Facade
review: One can't go inside beyond a point after entry gate. Grand Façade of Haveli and impeccable Architecture makes it worth to visit. Don't miss to look up for designer Jharokas (windows) while standing in the middle of courtyard of Haveli.

title: Nothing much but can see from outside
review: The Haveli is locked and ground floor is rented to a shop, There is nothing to see and can be avoided.

title: Passing by
review: The guide walked us here,its beautifully carved and breathtaking. People stay in the haveli hence you can only look from the outside.

title: Not worth it
review: The place is over hyped. You are not allowed to go inside. The neighborhood is full of newly built haveli's which have better facade than this haveli.

title: Havelis - must visit to see the intricate exterior
review: The area around Nathmal ji ki Haveli has many Havelis each with a slightly different structure. A few of them have opened them to visitors and also sell curios and object de art.

title: Worth to see once
review: One should go there at least once. you can have the experience of the history. YOu can see old things in the haveli. Worth to go there

title: Beautiful Balconies
review: Fairly similar to Patwaon ki haveli. I liked the balconies - gives lots of photo opportunities. You should give half a day to seeing the two havelis properly. Shopping just outside is nice.

title: Look only on the outside.
review: It's a wonderful haveli bur do not go inside. They give you a tour inside but meanwhile try to sell you their stuff. If you like shopping go, but if you don't like it they are disappointed and trie to dump you as sson as possible

title: Heritage structure
review: Only exteriors are accessible as owners are staying in it.  Excellent art work on stone, worth watching but maintenance could be much better to showcase India's heritage art

title: very well maintained
review: Private property, hence we were not allowed to enter the haveli. But don't know how foreigners were allowed to go up. There is a lot of commercialization everywhere though.

title: Haveli - Dwelling of the royalty
review: These havelis in Jaisalmer are a must visit; not only if you are interested in history but also to understand the architecture and lifestyle of noble men/courtesans. Do not be ashamed to ask for directions if you are on foot and believe me if you are the sorts who prefer it that way then you don't really need even a rickshaw since all the havelis are quite close to the Jaisalmer Fort. There are extra charges for using camera inside the premises - I did n't pay honestly since I was not too keen on the pictures part. You could also get some for free; basically the facade and outer structure which is what is the crux for me. Overall. unmissable. Visit and enjoy!

title: Nice carvings
review: It is average place. You can see the beautiful carved architecture from outside if time permits. OR it you have seen Patwon Ki Haveli, no need to visit from inside for this. Take some photographs and move on. One can skip this as well if you don't have time

title: Good.
review: This haveli is en-route from the fortress to the Patwon ki haveli.This is an interestin place. The carvings on the yellow stone are fantastic.

title: A time Pass
review: Simple Haweli instead you should visit some other place. Again if miss this then you are not going to miss some grate place to view. If it is on the way then just spend 20-30 minutes only.

title: Nothing much different
review: I am not a great critic of architecture and hence take the liberty of saying that there is not much different in this haveli. Better avoidable.

title: Build by two brothers in competition
review: Walking distance from Pawton ki Haveli. This Nathmal Ji ki haveli was build to serve as the residence of Diwan Mohata Nathmal, the then Prime Minister of Jaisalmer. Maharawal Beri Sal commissioned the construction of this Haveli. The architects of this haveli were Hathi and Lulu who happened to be brothers. There is a very interesting story regarding its construction. It is said that the two brothers started building different facets of haveli simultaneously.  The two sides of the haveli are not same. A guide will tell the many differences that you can not see yourself.

title: beautiful piece of architecture !
review: A must visit, once you are in jaisalmer.This is the ornamental architecture, and proof of the great artistes and artisans who lived in India many centuries ago !You will be swept away off your feet , once you see this marvel !As i said earlier, in my earlier review of a haveli, I have no words to describe this piece of ART !

title: Old intricately carved havelis!
review: There are 5 havelis, 4 privately run while one is government run and the cheapest in entry rates. Unfortunately not being lived in, bats are renting these places cheap! But the view from the top most terrace is worthy of  a visit.

title: Only allowed from outside
review: It is average place as you are not allowed to go inside the haweli. You can see the beautiful carved architecture from outside. Take some photographs and move on. However there were some foreigners who went inside which means people are trying would be making some adiitional money here. One can skip it since Patwon ki haveli is open and can be seen from inside. Just see from outside for 10-15 mins.

title: Almost same as patwon ki haveli from outside, but not open for viewing from inside
review: Its a very average visit. the places you can visit in this time will be worth your time. Also patwon ki haveli remains open from inside and is very similar to this.

title: Nice carvings
review: If you take a guide, he will explain the details of the haveli. The haveli was made by two artists and therefore you can make out that the haveli is divided in two parts and both the different from each other. Amazing piece of art.

title: A merchant house
review: Wonderful sculptures, including the elephants outside.  Not too hard to find and stunning, although poorly maintained.

title: Exquisite!
review: A must see in jaisalmer, the carvings on the haveli's facade are amazingly intricate and detailed, but since the haveli is occupied, the facade is all one can see, but still well worth the visit.

title: Definetly worth visiting
review: Make sure that you spent decent time here as the haveli's architecture & history is worth a sure visit.

title: Artistic exteriors
review: It is accomodated by descendants and internal visit is not allowed. One may click exterior pictures.

title: excellent haveli
review: it is very nice haveli made by two architects who are brothers. left and right side are different from outside and inside. it is just beautiful. they sell camel bone articles. overcharge so bargain well.

title: Beautiful
review: Another fascinating example of carving in profusion. The craftsmanship is simply out of this world. Good of the family still resident here to permit visitors some access to the inner courtyard.

title: ok
review: Checked from outside and ground floor, similar to patwaon ki haweli, downstairs few shops, families staying inside, cows relaxing on the road

title: Mindbongling
review: This Haveli was constucted by Diwan ( Prime Minister) of Raja of Jaisalmer. Two architecture brother were being given the work of constructing this Haveli. The duo out of competition designed the half portion each in different manners and using different scriptures just to gain the aclaim from the Diwan Saheb. The work is basically of interlocking stones without using any adhesive.  One and half Kg pure gold was also being used to decorate the meeting room on the first hall. In all a must visit Haveli.

title: Ordinary
review: This is another haveli in the Jaisalmer Fort complex that is considered as a point of visit but its pretty ordinary and not that impressive, just yet another old building.

title: Vaah
review: This Haveli is a great attraction in Jaisalmer, very much small kind of work in almost every where, greatly appreciated work by those workers.

title: Beautiful Haveli
review: Nathmal Ji Ki Haveli is one of the more famous havelis that the tourists visit in Jaisalmer. On paying the entrance fee one can visit the Haveli and see for themselves the beautiful architecture that caters for the desert hot weather like jharokhas and open courtyards. Definitely a nice place to visit in Jaisalmer.

title: Excellent example of stone work.
review: The place is the excellent work of the sand stone work. The left and right side of the place are constructed by two brothers and is having many differences in work is seen carefully from front.

title: Nathmal Ji Ki Haveli
review: Nathmal Ji Ki Haveli is one of famous haveli in Jaisalmer. amazing work and architecture. worth to visit this place. this place is constructed by two brothers.

title: Only Exterior is Good.
review: Only exterior is good and tourists are not allowed to view from inside since its people's are staying.

title: Not good
review: You can enter the varandah but not allowed to see the whole building..just took 5minutes to see..kind of waste of time..instead spend time on patwon ki haweli..which is far better..

title: GIFT SHOP RIP OFF
review: The building is beautiful but their gift shop is a total scam. They are selling plastic resin objects claiming that they are carved from camel bone, and for exorbitant prices. This kind of dishonesty and contemptuous behaviour towards tourists leaves a bad taste and creates distrust. Shame on them.

title: awesome fine stonework
review: can't go inside or upstairs. watch out as it is situated in a narrow lane of old city, lined by open sewers and dotted by fresh cow dung.

title: Haveli
review: Good Stonework , and worth seeing from outside it is 3 floor havelli keep going up on narrow stairs and nothing much to see , not kept well just some old stuff better to see from outside .

title: Vaah
review: This Haveli is a great attraction in Jaisalmer, very much small kind of work in almost every where, greatly appreciated work by those workers.

title: Beautiful Haveli
review: Nathmal Ji Ki Haveli is one of the more famous havelis that the tourists visit in Jaisalmer. On paying the entrance fee one can visit the Haveli and see for themselves the beautiful architecture that caters for the desert hot weather like jharokhas and open courtyards. Definitely a nice place to visit in Jaisalmer.

title: Nathmal Ji Ki Haveli
review: Nathmal Ji Ki Haveli is one of famous haveli in Jaisalmer. amazing work and architecture. worth to visit this place. this place is constructed by two brothers.

review: The place is the excellent work of the sand stone work. The left and right side of the place are constructed by two brothers and is having many differences in work is seen carefully from front.
